جسٹس ولیم او. ڈگلس نے امریکہ کی سپریم کو: Did Justice William O. Douglas serve on the US Supreme Court? William O. Douglas US Supreme Court

William O. Douglas was an Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States from 1939–75, making him the longest serving Justice on the Court. In a manner unthinkable today, Justice Douglas was a public advocate for the environment.
Did Justice William O. Douglas serve on the US Supreme Court? William O. Douglas US Supreme Court

Died: January 19, 1980 (age 81 years), Washington, D.C.

جسٹس ولیم او. ڈگلس نے 1939 سے 1975 تک خد: Justice William O. Douglas service years William O. Douglas tenure 1939 to 1975
Supreme Court Justice William O. Douglas served on the Supreme Court from 1939 to 1975.
Justice William O. Douglas service years William O. Douglas tenure 1939 to 1975

The Senate confirmed the appointment on April 4, 1939. Douglas had the longest tenure of any Justice, serving on the Supreme Court for thirty-six years, spanning the careers of five Chief Justices. He retired on November 12, 1975, and died on January 19, 1980, at the age of eighty-one.
